question_text: You need to build a highly scalable, cost-effective, and fault-tolerant serverless pipeline on GCP to process incoming sensor data from millions of IoT devices, performing real-time analytics and storing the results. How would you design this architecture?
hook_text: Building real-time IoT data pipelines on GCP? Here's how to process millions of sensor events serverlessly!
cta_text: Master serverless on GCP. Follow for more deep dives!

answer_sections.title: Ingestion & Triggering
answer_sections.text: Pub/Sub ingests data. Eventarc or direct subscriptions trigger processing.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Billions of IoT sensor readings flood in. Google Cloud Pub/Sub handles this massive ingestion, acting as a real-time messaging backbone, ensuring data durability and low latency delivery.

answer_sections.title: Processing & Transformation
answer_sections.text: Cloud Functions or Cloud Run process data. Perform real-time analytics.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: For light processing, Cloud Functions are ideal. For more complex transformations or ML inferences, containerized Cloud Run offers flexibility and auto-scaling, handling burst loads efficiently.

answer_sections.title: Storage & Observability
answer_sections.text: Store results in BigQuery. Monitor with Cloud Monitoring and Logging.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Processed insights land in BigQuery, a petabyte-scale data warehouse, ready for analytics and dashboards. Cloud Monitoring and Logging provide deep visibility into pipeline health and performance.
